column5: Electroconvulsive Therapy (ECT) is a medical procedure used to treat severe mental health conditions#Comma such as severe depression and certain forms of bipolar disorder. ECT involves passing an electric current through the brain to induce a controlled seizure. It's typically used when other treatments haven't been effective or when rapid improvement is necessary.
